ngiemboon: Afùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè la tÿɔ́g ncùb gie pʉ̀a láʼ pé ge péen té vʉʼʉ nyìŋ tà mbɔɔ meláʼ mie ntse tÿɔ́ʼte ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: King Ahasuerus imposed a tax throughout the land   even to the farthest shores.  # 10:1 Or imposed forced labor on the land and the coasts of the sea,# 10:1 Is 11:11; 24:15

ngiemboon: Mé la gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ membuʼú meŋwàʼne mie é laʼte mefàʼ mie mefùɔ Pɛ́ɛsè pɔ́ pe Mendɛ́sè la faʼ, á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ sɛ̌ lepuʼú ŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́, mé ŋweʼe mefàʼ mie fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè la lɔg ngʉ̀ʼ ye pɔ́ shÿɔg, éfaʼ. Mé la gíŋe ńdaʼte ntí gie fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè la kwéʼe Mandoshÿe ńtÿɔ́gɔ na jʉʼʉ lÿò.
en: All of his powerful and magnificent accomplishments   and the detailed account of Mordecai’s great rank with which the king had honored him,  # 10:2 Est 8:15 have they not been written in the Book of the Historical Events of the Kings of Media and Persia?  # 10:2 Est 2:23; 6:1–2

ngiemboon: Á nue Mandoshÿe laa ŋwáláʼtwómbúm we fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè, à laa nyìŋ mekùʼ mbwó pʉ̀a Yúndà, pɔ́ pú ńkwoŋo yé tɛʼ, á ké ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nò mbòŋo na pɔ́b, ḿbÿɛɛ nò pɔ́ na ntí gie à lɔgɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pʉ̀a pé é néŋe lé mbʉ́lè.
en: Mordecai the Jew was second only to King Ahasuerus.   He was famous among the Jews and highly esteemed by many of his relatives.  # 10:3 Est 8:16–17 He continued to pursue prosperity for his people and to speak for the well-being of all his descendants.  # 10:3 Neh 2:10
